title: Books about type
content:
I am trying to educate myself a little more about type, so I am looking for some titles that may help me. Anything really, as long as it covers the basics. Also I’d apreciate a recomendation for a good book about type in graphic design.

Thanx in front.

 [‹ Timeless](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006165249/http:/typophile.com/node/17458 "Go to previous forum topic") [Frutiger and similar typefaces in Bringhurst's classification system ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006165249/http:/typophile.com/node/17525 "Go to next forum topic")
author: karmachameleon

comments.content:
[books](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006165249/http:/typophile.com/wiki/books)

also, do a search. this question comes up a lot.

[thinking with type](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006165249/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/search-handle-url/ref=br_ss_hs/104-5974708-2751953?platform=gurupa&url=index%3Dblended&field-keywords=thinking+with+type&Go.x=0&Go.y=0&Go=Go) by Ellen Lupton. the book is a nice intro to typography if that’s what you’re looking for...

@ Paul: I did, but I was looking rather for recomendations from people here, there is too much to choose from when you search amazon or Typophile.

Thanx for your tips so far. ;)

 [Dnevnik eklektika](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006165249/http:/www.dnevnikeklektika.com/)

Maybe the [books](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006165249/http:/typophile.com/wiki/books) entry should have a kind of disclaimer at the top, directing people with questions about “starter books” to the [triumvirate](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006165249/http:/typophile.com/wiki/triumvirate) or even a new entry just with recommendations of this kind? For a first-timer, the [books](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006165249/http:/typophile.com/wiki/books) entry might be too complex...

Agreed. I have put in a small note and link. I hve also updated the Triumvirate to say that it’s not just Hrant’s top three intro books, but mine as well. There aren’t many things Hrant and I agree on, but that’s one of them.

T
